instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2879: What is 820-2879? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.ALL_SYS: What is ALL_SYS? This is a typo of ALL_SYS_PWRGD When you see ALL_SYS, assume they meant to type ALL_SYS_PWRGD.
definitions.R6905: What is R6905? Resistor between charger voltage and input to PP3V42_G3H power supply on older Macbooks, pre-2011 models. This resistor blows when C6990 has shorted to ground or U6990 has shorted to ground, and will result in PP3V42_G3H missing and the magsafe charger not having a light since PP3V42_G3H is necessary for the SMC to turn on and the onewire circuit to turn on..
definitions.AVREF_SMC: What is AVREF_SMC? AVREF_SMC is a reference voltage provided to the SMC so that its sensors have a reference to work from, this should be 3.3v.
definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.SMC_PM_G2_EN: What is SMC_PM_G2_EN? SMC_PM_G2_EN is a signal that comes from the SMC that is a prerequsite for all of the enable signals for the S5 rails to come on, such as P3V3S5_EN. S5 rails will not come on if SMC_PM_G2_EN is not coming..
definitions.P3V3S5_EN: What is P3V3S5_EN? P3V3S5_EN is a signal that enables the power chip responsible for creating PP3V3_S5 when it is high. Signals with _EN mean that whatever is mentioned before the _EN will be enabled or turned on when the signal is high. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on.
threads.message:
Hi,


This board had liquid damage in <CHIP>U6990</CHIP>. First PPBUS was 1V and going down, and also all main rails were bad. So finally i checked that <RESISTOR>R6905</RESISTOR>, <CHIP>U6990</CHIP> and <CHIP>U7600</CHIP> were bad and i replaced them. Now i get green light on magsafe, ppbus and other rails are stable but it doesnt starts. Trying SMC bypass i get fans spinning but no chime no boot. 


In SMC BYPASS <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS</SIGNAL> is 0,03V.

ALso Checked <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> 17/18 and 27/28 are ok.


Any idea what else can be checked?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on.
threads.message:
Board stays on, but no activity starting in SMC bypass mode?
Then you have a SMC sensor issue.

Check first <SIGNAL>AVREF_SMC</SIGNAL> voltage.
Next check <SIGNAL>SMC_DCIN</SIGNAL>/<SIGNAL>BATT_ISENSE</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>SMC_PBUS_VSENSE</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on.
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>AVREF_SMC</SIGNAL>  is ok (3.3V)

<SIGNAL>SMC_DCIN</SIGNAL>/<SIGNAL>BATT_ISENSE</SIGNAL>  - nothing (0.05V)


<SIGNAL>SMC_PBUS_VSENSE</SIGNAL> - 0 V 


Already changed SMC from donor board and same result.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on.
threads.message:
After SMC replacement when toggle <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> machine goes to S0 state ( no fan, no chime no image) and <SIGNAL>SMC_PBUS_VSENSE</SIGNAL> now 2.1 in S0 mode. 


GPU is getting a little warm. CPU cold

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on.
threads.message:
Any pulse on basic signals, in normal mode?
Trigger <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> and check power on sequence.

"Board stays on, but no activity starting in SMC bypass mode?"
???

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on.
threads.message: Solved. When was working <CHIP>U7600</CHIP> area i put fuse instead of ressistance <RESISTOR>R7601</RESISTOR> :D

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on.
threads.message: Still having problems. Battery is shorting board. It starts without battery and works fine, sometimes even it starts with battery too but usually when i start without battery then connect it fan stops. I already changed  ISL and SMC again. PPBUS is 12.60V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on.
threads.message:
Never connect the battery with board already powered from charger!
You can fry the SMC one day...

Check again resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28 at <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>.
Also monitor <SIGNAL>CHGR_A</SIGNAL>/BMON and <SIGNAL>SMC_DCIN</SIGNAL>/<SIGNAL>BATT_ISENSE</SIGNAL> levels.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on.
threads.message:
17/18 - 3.3
27/28 - 21


All buttom measerments are done with magsafe and battery connected: 


<SIGNAL>CHGR_A</SIGNAL>/BMON - 0

<SIGNAL>SMC_DCIN</SIGNAL> - 0.6 (is it ok?)

<SIGNAL>BATT_ISENSE</SIGNAL> - 0V


"Never connect the battery with board already powered from charger!"

Thanks for that, i tried it many times but never thought that it may cause SMC damage. Something new learnt today:D

"voltages on this rails, or you mean resistance?"
Volyage level, of course.

"<SIGNAL>CHGR_A</SIGNAL>/BMON - 0"
Cannot be just 0V, if board turns on.
Maybe less than 0.5V, but need exact values.

Did you try known good battery?

Also try another (original) battery.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on.
threads.message:
The basic signals wich you check for a non-power issue.
3V42/<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>RTC_RST_L</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>SM_INTRUDER_L</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>0V9_S5</SIGNAL>...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on.
threads.message:
PPBUS - 12.3 ( bad smc? i changed it twice, from donor)
<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> - 3.42 V
<SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> - 3.4 V

<SIGNAL>RTC_RST_L</SIGNAL> - 3.4V
<SIGNAL>SM_INTRUDER_L</SIGNAL> - 3.4V

<SIGNAL>PP0V9_S5</SIGNAL> this one is 0V.

So if pbus from battery on 12.3 is ok then the fail must be <SIGNAL>0V9_S5</SIGNAL> so i went to <CHIP>U7750</CHIP> and see that <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> is not generated from battery.


Is it <CHIP>U7200</CHIP> not recieving <SIGNAL>P3V3S5_EN</SIGNAL> from <CHIP>U7840</CHIP> because this one doesnt get <SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL>. So my fail is SMC?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on.
threads.message:
Sorry, S5 state not achived on battery only, so no <SIGNAL>0V9_S5</SIGNAL> available.

12.3V on battery alone?
Did you try known good battery?

What u think?


P.S. connected display and from battery i can make fan spin in smc by pass but no image not bootng.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on.
threads.message: If board starts with battery and charger in SMC bypass, check all voltage and current sensors in normal mode (pages 39/40).

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on.
threads.message:
i retake this board finally. Anyone can help me with that?

Run from charger, charge battery, but not running from battery. The only way to run from battery is to boot it in smc bypass or boot with magsafe connected and disconnect if after booting

When doesn't start, of course.
